title: Exhibits and Sponsorship Manager
required_experience:

description:
The Exhibits and Sponsorship Manager is responsible for overseeing and/or assisting in the planning and operations of the AAE Annual Meeting exhibitions, as well as special assigned meetings.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Manage all aspects of exhibit operations and development of exhibit sponsorship and advertising prospectus for AAE meetings and events.
• Create advertising and sponsorship opportunities for each meeting and manage from creation to execution.
• Oversee all activities on the exhibition floor including sponsorship activations and deliverables.
• Assist in the development of meeting budgets and maintain expense control as related to the budget.
• Implement all sponsorship deliverables for AAE annual meeting and events after sold by Corporate Relations Manager.
• Generate revenue from sponsorships and advertising opportunities as well as increased exhibitor attendance. Develop floor plans and implementation of exhibit rules and regulations for Annual Meeting and other meetings as assigned.
• Manage all exhibition sales, operations, goals, and objectives.
• Serve as liaison with exhibitors and sponsors.
• Manage the general services contractor relationship.
• Serve as liaison to Exhibits Advisory Committee and assigned volunteer committees.
• Research, strategize and collaborate with Assistant Executive Director, Meetings & CE to implement new ways of increasing exhibitor sales and ROI at assigned events.
• Develop and maintain knowledge of endodontic issues related to corporate community, background of endodontic companies, exhibit guidelines, and related matters.
• Perform other duties as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
• Ability to represent Associations and their Foundations with utmost professionalism.
• Knowledge and experience in exhibits and sponsorship sales.
• Detail Oriented with excellent analytical, communication, time management, collaboration, project management and organizational skills.
• Diplomacy, discretion and the ability to sell both tangible and intangible benefits.
• Creativity and the ability to identify common interests and create synergy among organizations.
• Networking and sales skills.
• Experience working in Cadmium Exhibits Module and Nible AMS a plus
EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION
• Related Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, related experience.
• Certified Exhibition Management (CEM) designation preferred.
• Minimum of 5 years of related experience in membership association non-profit exhibits management, sponsorship/advertising sale and logistics.
